snippet: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is running fewer trains during the morning and evening rush on a group of weekdays with traditionally low peak-hour ridership.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority is experimenting with running fewer subway trains during morning and evening rush hours on a group of weekdays, including Good Friday and Columbus Day, with traditionally low peak-hour ridership; program is projected to save MTA $200,000 annually.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority is running fewer trains during the morning and evening rush on a group of weekdays with traditionally low peak-hour ridership.

headline.seo: M.T.A. Reduces Subway Service on a Few ‘Minor Holidays’
headline.main: Less Service in the Subway? It May Be a ‘Minor Holiday’
headline.print_headline: Less Service in the Subway? It May Be a ‘Minor Holiday’
